data: Restricted to Department of Anesthesiology and Acute Pain Service (APS)
Admit to Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) / Anesthesiology - Also order ANES Multi-Modal Pain Management PowerPlan
Do not order from this order set if patient has received intrathecal or epidural opioid
Monitoring Orders are for Inpatient Ward
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 24 hour, then q4h q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
q1h until controlled then q4h q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
q1h until controlled then q4h q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
If Respiratory Rate is 8/min OR less:
If: Sedation Score (POSS) 3 AND Respiratory rate greater than 8/min, then: Hold PCA until POSS 2 or less
If: Sedation Score (POSS) 3 or greater AND Respiratory rate equal to or less than 8/min, then: Hold PCA and give naloxone
For patients at risk for increased respiratory depression (e.g. severe OSA):
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 24 hour, then q4h
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 24 hour, then q4h
Following increase in PCA Dose or decrease in lockout interval:

Do NOT give any Opioids, CNS Depressants, and other analgesics unless approved by the Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) / Anesthesiology (EXCEPT in Critical Care Units: CSICU and ICU)
For PCA post intrathecal opioid orders please refer to the ANES Post Intrathecal / Epidural Monitoring and Patient Controlled Analgesia (PCA) (Module) Order Set
Discontinue ANES Patient Controlled Analgesia (PCA) (Module) PowerPlan when patient is well managed on oral analgesics
HYDROmorphone 0.6 mg/mL PCA with clinician bolus 9 mg/15 mL

1mg PCA starting dose, 6 min lockout interval, 0.8 mg PCA minimum dose, 1.5 mg PCA maximum dose, 30 mg 4-hour limit, titrate instructions: increase to PCA maximum dose if pain uncontrolled titrate PCA dose by 0.5 mg increments, 1mg q10min, 3 clinician boluses/h max, pump type: Alaris, therapy type: opioid extreme, infusion mode: PCA dose only, volume: 50 mL, IV

2mg PCA starting dose, 6 min lockout interval, 0.8 mg PCA minimum dose, 3 mg PCA maximum dose, 30 mg 4-hour limit, titrate instructions: increase to PCA maximum dose if pain uncontrolled titrate PCA dose by 0.5 mg increments, 2mg q10min, 3 clinician boluses/h max, pump type: Alaris, therapy type: opioid extreme, infusion mode: PCA dose only, volume: 50 mL, IV
morphine 3 mg/mL PCA with clinician bolus 45 mg/15 mL

5 mg PCA starting dose, 8 min lockout interval, 4 mg PCA minimum dose, 7.5 mg PCA maximum dose, 150 mg 4-hour limit, titrate instructions: increase to PCA maximum dose if pain uncontrolled titrate PCA dose as needed, 5mg q10min, 3 clinician boluses/h max, pump type: Alaris, therapy type: opioid extreme, infusion mode: PCA dose only, volume: 50 mL, IV

6 mg PCA starting dose, 8 min lockout interval, 4 mg PCA minimum dose, 9 mg PCA maximum dose, 150 mg 4-hour limit, titrate instructions: increase to PCA maximum dose if pain uncontrolled titrate PCA dose as needed, 6mg q10min, 3 clinician boluses/h max, pump type: Alaris, therapy type: opioid extreme, infusion mode: PCA dose only, volume: 50 mL, IV

Simultaneous administration of other opioids, tranquilizers, hypnotics or sedatives via IV or other routes will have a synergistic effect causing increased sedation and respiratory depression
Naloxone orders are available in the ANES Multi-Modal Pain Management Powerplan
0.04 mg, IV, q2min, PRN reverse opioid effect, drug form: inj
0.04 mg, subcutaneous, q2min, PRN reverse opioid effect, drug form: inj
